content: The hidden feature of federal crimes is that helpers and offenders face the same punishment under 18 U.S.C. 2, which treats anyone who orders a federal crime with the same consequences. This secondary liability is similar to conspiracy, as society fears the crimes of multiple individuals more than those of one. The aiding and abetting subsection (§2(a)) is more commonly prosecuted than the causes subsection (§2(b). The aiding and abetting subsection (§2(a)) of 18 U.S.C. 2 is frequently prosecuted, requiring the defendant to associate themselves with the crime and consciously assist in its commission. Aiding and abetting involves assisting in someone else's crime by embracing it and consciously contributing to its success.
